review.rating: Hotel was very good, The young lady at reception was very helpful,
review.comment_positive:
The hotel is not far from the beach , 
or the Christ the King statue (main reason why  I was visiting Vung Tau ).
Leaving the lobby of the hotel ,turn right ,walk about 15 minutes , until the junction at the beach road ,here turn right,and walk another 15 minutes to the entrance of The Statue , around 800 steps later  you are there 
well worth a visit , the day I visited was a weekday ,around 9.0 am and was fairly quiet, no ques to walk the steps inside the statue u ( I believe it gets busy at the weekend)
up to the viewing galleries located on each arm . free entrance to the statue  but can give a donation via a box .
I think there is a dress code to enter the statue , so no swim suits, crop tops ,thongs etc..   casual but respectful 
by the way the murals on the outside of the statue are worth a look ,
another thing one can respect, is the engineering of the whole site, .
